channel.title: Brother, can't connect?
channel.description: Ok, well others can connect to my server but, when my brother trys to he can't. We're both connected to the same modem, although hes connected wirelessly and I LAN. He can't connect if he uses the server ip, or 0.0.0.0 for the ip. The only other possible thing would be, 1 connection per ip. Although if thats the issue, how can I change it and if I'm only hosting the server, not actually connected, and he still can't connect. We could rule out the 1 Connection Per Ip Problem? Any help would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

Ok, thanks everyone. I found a solution, thankyou.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @MoparScapeHelp MoparScapeHelp
item.description:
@MoparScapeHelp wrote:

Ok I think I foudn your problem.
Try restarting both computers (yours first) then his.
Restart your router
Tell your bro to open up the client BEFORE you RUN SERVER
Then you run the server without signing in, and let your bro login.
If he logs in, then you log in.
If he can’t then tell me, Ill try to reasearch more.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

Well, your post are very nice and all. I just tryed them all, none of which solve the problem. Also, i’m not going to try no-ip. Its to much of a hassle, it wouldn’t work (i’ve hosted previous servers in the past and it worked but not now). Although hes tryed connecting to 0.0.0.0 and the server ip. So If anyone knows of what it might be, any post appreciated!

Read full topic

item.title: Brother, can't connect?

@MoparScapeHelp wrote:

Thanks for explaining it correctly

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“MoparScapeHelp, post:7, topic:269433”]Well, then how come I can go on at the same time on 2 differenct computers? And I have 1 ip per connection on.[/quote]Then you’re running on 2 different internet connections.

If you have a wireless router and 5 computers, if all of those computers connect through the one router they will all have the same IP.

He explains it in much more detail. ^^

Read full topic

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:6, topic:269433”]I’m just going to try and come up with a way to fix this right here, so just tell if it doesn’t work.

Search for this in Client.java:

if (isIpOn(connectedFrom)) {

Change it to:

if (isIpOn(connectedFrom) && connectedFrom != 127.0.0.1 && connectedFrom != localhost && connectedFrom != YOURIP) {

Change YOURIP to your IP address.

The bit you’re changing is what checks if somebody else from the same IP is already online. If they are, they’re blocked from logging in.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2009, 02:56:22 pm[/size][hr][quote author=MoparScapeHelp link=topic=355559.msg2721349#msg2721349 date=1238014010]
2x, I think that 2 different computers are 2 different IP’s?
And tell me your PortForwarding settings. I think I know whats wrong
DONT TELL ME ANY PERSONAL INFO LOL
[/quote]2 Computers != 2 IPs

They may be two seperate computers, but they’re still connecting to the internet from the same modem/router; the same internet connection.[/quote]
No. Each computer will have a different ip address.

If you are using a router, your router has given each of your computers a different private ip address and your router is using the only public address. So from the Internet side, it may seem that your computers have the same address, it is actually the router they see, not your computers. Your router is using a protocol called NAT (native address translation) to allow your 2 computers to use the same connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

I’m just going to try and come up with a way to fix this right here, so just tell if it doesn’t work.

Search for this in Client.java:

if (isIpOn(connectedFrom)) {

Change it to:

if (isIpOn(connectedFrom) && connectedFrom != 127.0.0.1 && connectedFrom != localhost && connectedFrom != YOURIP) {

Change YOURIP to your IP address.

The bit you’re changing is what checks if somebody else from the same IP is already online. If they are, they’re blocked from logging in.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2009, 02:56:22 pm[/size][hr][quote=“MoparScapeHelp, post:2, topic:269433”]2x, I think that 2 different computers are 2 different IP’s?
And tell me your PortForwarding settings. I think I know whats wrong
DONT TELL ME ANY PERSONAL INFO LOL[/quote]2 Computers != 2 IPs

They may be two seperate computers, but they’re still connecting to the internet from the same modem/router; the same internet connection.

Read full topic

item.description:
@MoparScapeHelp wrote:

Oh. thats weird… It might be registered on the same modem or something. Try using No-ip though. If you want me to, I could host your server, and you and ur brother can go on

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Try and get him to connect to your private IP address, the 192.168.. number you port forwarded too.

item.title: Brother, can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

Yes, they should be 2 different ips, although people tell me otherwise so Idk. Well I was gonna use no-ip DUC. Although I couldn’t get server to host and someone suggested dyndns to host. So I tryed it, others can connect when I use www.dyndns.com to host… Others can connect but not him, which doesn’t make since.
